citation.article-title: Rhodothermus marinus, gen. nov., a thermophilic, halophilic bacterium from submarine hot springs in Iceland

p.s: Description of Rhodothermus marinus sp. nov.
Rhodothermus marinus (ma. ri'nus, L. masc. adj. marinus thriving in the sea, describing its biotope)
Cells never occur in chains or filaments.
Optimal growth at 65 Â°C and pH 7 and about 2% (w/v) NaCl.
The natural habitat is submarine alkaline hot springs.
The type strain is Rhodothermus marinus, DSM 4252 (ATCC 43812) (isolated from a submarine hot spring at Reykjanes, NW Iceland).
